title: Jacob Rees-Mogg says he can't confirm Saturday sitting of parliament – video
text:
The leader of the Commons has told MPs he is unable to confirm whether the Saturday sitting will go ahead.

Scottish National party MP Angus MacNeil chided Rees-Mogg, saying: ‘Today is Tuesday and the UK parliament cannot tell us if we are sitting on Saturday.’

‘Brexit Saturday will be in the company of world war two Saturday, Suez [crisis] Saturday and Falklands [War] Saturday. This calamity is not in the best of company.’

If parliament does sit this Saturday, it will be only the fourth time it has happened since the second world war
description: If parliament does sit this Saturday, it will be only the fourth time it has happened since the second world war
